discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
Entity scoping does not allow identification of both technical and business owner out of the box.

comments.content: actually, chatGPT and gemini anwser is BCD, A B C D all makes sense, however, given its SN so A and D for sure, it's just a toss up between B and C, guess consistent approach is kinda like the SN thing so i think the actual answer should be A. B. and D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
Answer:
 B. Provides a consistent approach to setting up risks and controls
 C. Allows identification of both a technical owner and a business owner
 D. Dynamic in nature. As new records meet criteria, they will be added as entities

questions.question_text: Why is Entity scoping important when implementing GRC? (Choose three.)

choices.D: Dynamic in nature. As new records meet criteria, they will be added as entities
choices.C: Allows identification of both a technical owner and a business owner
choices.B: Provides a consistent approach to setting up risks and controls
choices.A: Auto-generates controls when control objective is scoped with entity type
choices.E: Provides a consistent approach to issue tracking

choices.D: It is publicly traded in the United States
choices.C: It processes data from individuals in the European Union
choices.B: It faces the most pervasive cyber-threats

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. It processes data from individuals in the European Union
Explanation: "The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a European Union law that applies to any company that processes personal data of individuals residing in the EU, regardless of the company's location."
Source: Gemini

Selected Answer: C
Correction: GDPR: General Data Protection Regulation (2016/679, "GDPR") is a Regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy in the EU and the European Economic Area (EEA)

Selected Answer: D
GDPR: General Data Protection Regulation (2016/679, "GDPR") is a Regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy in the EU and the European Economic Area (EEA)

questions.question_text: Why would a company need to comply with the General Data Protection Regulation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
What is a risk register?
 A. Repository for all unidentified risks
 B. Repository for risk frameworks
 C. Repository for risk assessments
 D. Repository for all identified risks
 E. Repository for risk criteria
Answer: D. Repository for all identified risks
Explanation: makes sense to document indetified risks rather than unidentifed risks
Source: Trust me bro.

questions.question_text: Which tables store the links from the Entity Types to Policies and Entity Types to Control Objectives? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Answer:
B. [sn_compliance_m2m_policy_profile_type]
C. [sn_compliance_m2m_statement_profile_type]
Explanation: A. and D. doesn't exist as a table in SN, while
 - Policy to Entity Type[sn_compliance_m2m_policy_profile_type]
 - Control Objective to Entity Type[sn_compliance_m2m_statement_profile_type]
Source: PDI, sys_db_obejct list view

questions.question_text: Control Objectives are not active until the parent policy is in which of the following states?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. Published
Explanation: Policy lifecycle is Draft -> Review -> Awaiting Approval -> Published -> Retired, policies needs to be publishd before control objectives can be active
Source: PDI, nav menu, PDI, sn_compliance_policy.do
